description:
AML is a memory management library designed to ease the use of complex
memory topologies and complex data layout optimizations for high-
performance computing applications.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: git
dependencies.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: hip
dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependencies.name: hwloc
dependencies.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: ocl-icd
dependencies.description:
This package aims at creating an Open Source alternative to vendor
specific OpenCL ICD loaders.

dependencies.name: oneapi-level-zero
dependencies.description:
oneAPI Level Zero Loader. Applications that need low-level control of a
oneAPI level zero device link against the loader. The loader depends on
a separately installed level zero driver. See https://dgpu-
docs.intel.com/technologies/level-zero.html for information on how to
install the driver.

dependencies.name: pkgconf
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
